intro: Citharexylum subflavescens, commonly known as the golden-flowered citharexylum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
